file_content.text: Hey, uh. Look, lay off the lightning this time, okay?
Just open this case for me.
The case--hurry.
Yeah, gladly.
It's so much fun.
Never! [Shock her]
Aaaaah!
I can't take much more of this. Just give me the case already!
I thought you liked it.
I'm sorry.
Hey, sorry, I guess I'm just not that kind of girl.
Now give me a second with this case....
There--there's your lightsaber. Now go, please.
Rosen won't be bothering you anymore.
The fool is dead.
Your debts are cleared.
You are free from Rosen.
Give my regards to Rosen next time you see him.
Say "hi" to Gyl for me.
I have no more business with you.
I'm done here.
The oath's filled now, right? We're even?
Here's something to remember me by.
Just one more thing. [Shock her]
Aaagh! Please... no more.
So did you give that scumbag Rosen a taste of his own blood?
Your debt is cleared.
You're free.
I couldn't be bothered.
No.
That's none of your business.
What do you care?
I guess that's a Sith for you, Mila. Figures. Anyway, let me see that case.
He won't be bothering anyone anymore.
He's dead.
Thanks, I appreciate that a lot. Now let me see that case.
Just a second here... there you go. I hope it's what you wanted.
Anyway, now that I don't have to pay Rosen off, I'll probably ditch this place. I owe you one.
Perhaps we'll meet again.
I might come back.
I'll find you when I need you.
I'll hold you to that.
I hope I'm up to the task.
You did your duty.
Forget it.
Thanks again--I really appreciate it. I'm my own person again.
Good luck out there.
Just open this case for me before I run out of patience.
Get to the case already!
This should only take a second... there you go. I hope this makes us even.
Not that I don't like playing steward for a Sith, but I got a lot on my mind as it is.
Rosen's in the upper level industrial sites. He has your lightsaber.
You're Mila Escalus, aren't you? I believe you have a lightsaber that belongs to me.
I knew this would happen. I warned him, but he wouldn't listen.
Please don't kill me--I'll get the lightsaber back. I promise!
You don't have the lightsaber!
What?
It's not my fault. It's my father's.
You broke your oath; why shouldn't I kill you?
Why not?
It was my ancestor's oath, and I didn't break it, my no-good excuse for a father did.
Calm down.
It was my no-good father. He broke the oath.
Dad was never very smart, but a couple of years ago, he topped himself.
Put everything we had--lightsaber included--on the sabacc table against a sleazebag named Gyl Rosen, a known cheater. Lost it all.
I'd like a word with your father.
I need to speak to him.
Just be happy you're dealing with me and not my ancestor himself.
You're lucky Kallig's not here.
You will wish your father had walked away from that table.
You will pay!
I warned him! But "Mil," he says, "you gotta stop believing in myths."
Now he's dead, and I'm paying off his debts. All of them.
I'd get the lightsaber back, but Rosen has it--and he's holed up in the industrial area. It's too dangerous, and I can't exactly afford help.
It's nothing I can't handle.
No need to hire anyone.
I should kill you where you stand.
You should die for this.
Your cowardice sickens me.
Excuses! [Shock her]
Aaaaaah!
Look, you want to go, fine, but I'd get killed. Rosen'll have guards everywhere.
Oh and--please don't kill me--only an Escalus can open the lightsaber case. Some kind of genetic lock. So if you get it, bring it here.
I'm sorry, do I know you?
